47:40 Caption: One of the defenders reacts at the last minute to brilliantly block a pass from Danilo (Real Madrid). Real Madrid force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
47:45 Caption: Lucas (Real Madrid) decides to take a short corner instead of crossing into the box.
48:55 Caption: That's the end of the match.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The enthralling clash between Celta Vigo and Real Madrid unfolded dramatically with an intriguing blend of technical skill, fierce competition, and a showcase of both teams' tactical play. Real Madrid emerged victorious with a 4-1 scoreline, but the match's journey provided fans with numerous talking points and moments of high tension.

The game kicked off with Real Madrid initiating the attack. Barely seconds into the game, a foul was committed by a zealous Celta Vigo player, setting the tone for a physically intense contest. Real wasted no time in asserting their dominance, as they tested the Celta Vigo defense early on with a shot on target within the first minute, although the move ultimately culminated in the ball going out of play.

As Real Madrid continued to probe with urgency, they earned a corner by the third minute, showcasing their early intent. Celta Vigo, however, responded by temporarily halting Real's momentum through a series of throw-ins and strategic clearances. It wasn’t until the 9th minute that Celta Vigo announced their presence with a shot on target, signaling their willingness to fight back.

The game witnessed its first breakthrough in the 9th minute when Real Madrid’s relentless efforts paid off and they netted the opening goal. Celta Vigo had their work cut out early in the match as they had to fight back from a goal down. Celta's immediate response through John Guidetti, who aimed a powerful header towards the goal just outside the box, was commendable but thwarted by an alert goalkeeper.

Celta Vigo pressed on, with Jonny creating space and attempting a long-distance shot which was blocked, demonstrating their resolve to equalize. The tactical battle continued with both sides committing fouls, resulting in a free-kick opportunity for Celta Vigo, presenting another attacking opportunity for them. Daniel Wass, with his long-range free-kick, attempted to balance the scales but his effort was efficiently managed by the Real Madrid defense.

In the ensuing minutes, Celta Vigo maintained the pressure with repeated shots on target, corner kicks, and an aggressive pursuit of every loose ball. Pione Sisto, in particular, was in a promising position after a precise pass but was hindered by the Real defense. His consequent corner kick found no home among his teammates, and the ball was cleared, symbolizing the pattern of Celta's frustrations.

As the first half progressed, Real Madrid's defensive discipline began to shine through, as they repeatedly intercepted and cleared Celta's attempts. Simultaneously, Real Madrid kept looking dangerous when attacking, forcing Celta Vigo to stay alert at the back. The intensity of the contest was palpable, with multiple instances of the ball going out of play interspersed with fierce pressing.

The tactical seesaw continued with both sides trading fouls, free-kick attempts, and several cautionary instances. Real Madrid's Casemiro received a yellow card for a harsh challenge after a period dominated by strategic fouling and tactical free-kicks. Despite isolated attempts by Celta Vigo to equalize, Real Madrid had firm control over their defensive structure.

The first half concluded with Real Madrid enduring a few nerve-wracking moments, like Karim Benzema's shot being brilliantly saved by Sergio Alvarez. The halftime whistle blew with Real Madrid leading by a single goal, leaving Celta Vigo with all to play for in the second half.

As the second half commenced, it took Real Madrid just over two minutes to double their lead. A brilliant pass from Isco found Cristiano Ronaldo who expertly slotted the ball home with a low shot that ricocheted off the left post. This further put Celta Vigo on the back foot, compelling them to play catch-up in a fast-paced second half.

Celta Vigo's attempts to wrest back control were evident but marred by a lack of precision and discipline. A high ball towards Pablo Pedro Hernandez was intercepted, earning Celta a corner, but a subsequent offside call against John Guidetti limited their offensive progress. Real Madrid maintained composure with clearances and throw-ins, frustrating Celta's efforts.

The game took a turn when Iago Aspas received a second yellow card for simulation, resulting in his dismissal and leaving Celta Vigo a man down. This incident tipped the balance significantly in favor of Real Madrid, making Celta’s challenge even steeper.

With Celta Vigo reduced to ten men, Real Madrid's dominance became apparent. Their tactical discipline and ability to maintain possession were commendable, as they strung together tiki-taka styled passing. The frustration on Celta’s side began to show as several players were booked for various infractions. Jonny, in particular, received a yellow card for unseemly gestures, reflecting the mounting pressure his side was under.

Despite being a man down, Celta Vigo didn't relent in their pursuit. They eventually managed to find the net in the 24th minute through John Guidetti's deflected shot, offering them a glimmer of hope. However, their jubilation was short-lived as Real Madrid immediately responded. Within the minute, Marcelo assisted Karim Benzema who coolly finished from close range, restoring Real Madrid’s two-goal cushion.

The game entered a phase of substitutions and continued tactical adjustments with Real Madrid bringing on fresh legs to maintain their momentum. Celta Vigo's frustrations boiled over resulting in more fouls and yellow cards. An exemplary performance in goal by Sergio Alvarez kept Celta Vigo in with a chance, as he made several crucial saves including a stunning denial of an effort from Isco.

Celta Vigo substituted Pione Sisto, and their resilient efforts continued even as Real Madrid from time to time forced errors through their relentless pressing. The final substitution saw Claudio Beauvue replace John Guidetti. Despite all efforts, Celta Vigo's fate was sealed as Real Madrid hammered the final nail into the coffin with a fourth goal.

Karim Benzema’s contribution remained significant throughout, involved in securing the fourth goal for Real Madrid in the dying moments. He set up Toni Kroos who calmly slotted the ball into the bottom left corner, concluding the scoring spree and realistically ending any comeback hopes for Celta Vigo.

The match was marred by multiple yellow cards, reflective of the game’s aggressive undertone. Pablo Pedro Hernandez and Sergio Ramos both received cautions for unsporting behavior, epitomizing the fiercely contested nature of the match. As the game drew to an end, Real Madrid had successfully neutralized Celta Vigo’s attacking threats with a combination of tactical astuteness and clinical finishing.

The encounter was a testament to Real Madrid's tactical adeptness and their ability to capitalize on their numerical advantage. Celta Vigo, despite moments of brilliance, were outplayed and outmaneuvered particularly after going a man down. The final whistle brought an end to an intense match leaving Real Madrid the worthy victors with a commanding 4-1 result on a day that witnessed everything - goals, fouls, tactical brilliance, and passionate football.
